intro: Homalomena kualakohensis, commonly known as the Kualako holly fern, is a rare and endemic plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix and spathe. The plant features broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green with a waxy texture. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
